Description: Wine description, Lavish richness offers a wide aromatic range of black and red fruits which harmonises with its intense purple colour. It also offers hints of mint, plum, chocolate, coffee or liquorice, a bouquet of almond, toast, tobacco and vanilla. Maturity gives it a nose of spices, truffles, undergrowth and gamey scents: fur, leather. Its taste is characterised by their silky tannins, their balance and concentration, enhanced by a delicate oaky note.

Description: Wine description, Complexity, elegance and longevity are the hallmarks of this race. The nose is distinguished by a bouquet of aromas, mixing blackcurrant and violet, vanilla and cinnamon. On the palate, the tannins appear mature and melted, revealing a strong and affirmed structure, a surprising suppleness, perfect harmony and long persistency.

The finish is very fresh, dense, persistent on a brilliant fruit associated with mineral notes.

name:
Château Angelus
Le Carillon d’Angélus Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2016
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Château Angelus'], ['Grapes', '100% Merlot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Libournais', 'Saint-Émilion', 'Saint-Émilion Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Émilion'], ['Alcohol content', '14%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', "Château Angélus has a second wine named Le Carillon d’Angélus. It was first made in 1987 and accounts for 20 to 30% of the estate’s total production, depending on the year. It is blended from varying proportions of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon that are partly picked on unclassified plots with clayey limestone and clayey sandy limestone soils. The vines are cared for in exactly the same way as those used to make the main wine. The same attention is paid to detail and selection during the harvest and winemaking as for the main wine. It is also aged in barrels, but not for so long and only half the wood is new in order to suit the wine's specific requirements. Le Carillon d’Angélus therefore has its own identity and style. It is made to be kept for the mid-term and displays enjoyable fruit aromas of plum and sour cherry and has velvet-smooth tannins."]]
Description: Wine description, "Château Angélus has a second wine named Le Carillon d’Angélus. It was first made in 1987 and accounts for 20 to 30% of the estate’s total production, depending on the year. It is blended from varying proportions of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon that are partly picked on unclassified plots with clayey limestone and clayey sandy limestone soils. The vines are cared for in exactly the same way as those used to make the main wine. The same attention is paid to detail and selection during the harvest and winemaking as for the main wine. It is also aged in barrels, but not for so long and only half the wood is new in order to suit the wines specific requirements. Le Carillon d’Angélus therefore has its own identity and style. It is made to be kept for the mid-term and displays enjoyable fruit aromas of plum and sour cherry and has velvet-smooth tannins."

name:
Cos d'Estournel
Cos d'Estournel 2014
about_wine: [['Winery', "Cos d'Estournel"], ['Grapes', '100% Cabernet Sauvignon'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Saint-Estèphe'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Estèphe'], ['Alcohol content', '14%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites, egg allergens, milk allergens'], ['Bottle closure', 'Cork'], ['Wine description', 'The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.']]
Description: Wine description, The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.

Description: Wine description, With considerable opulence, a chocolate, mocha, black cherry and berry spectrum of aromas and flavours. Description: Wine description, It showed a lovely, deep, concentrated colour in the decanter, with an almost inky appearance. On the palate it has a full, not-quite creamy character, with a very grippy, precisely laid-out structure. Finely extracted, with lovely body and full, rich texture, this wine has a beautifully seductive style. Initially so stylish, the midpalate is where it reveals a little more tannin and precise acidity.

Description: Wine description, Deep, intense, crimson red. The bouquet is more subtle, fresher and fruitier than the fombrauge. This is a delicious wine, rich in fruit and tannins but subtle. Full-flavored, it also has a long, powerful, fleshy, but also aromatic finish. A wine for laying down.

name:

about_wine: [['Winery', 'Château Clerc Milon'], ['Grapes', 'Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Pauillac'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Pauillac'], ['Alcohol content', '13%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'The nose reveals finely toasted spice and tobacco notes combined with more intense aromas of red fruit and cherry stone with a mineral touch. Description: Wine description, The nose reveals finely toasted spice and tobacco notes combined with more intense aromas of red fruit and cherry stone with a mineral touch. The long, warm-hearted finish is lifted by a slightly saline taste.

Description: Wine description, Dark with good concentration, and the nose has a tightly defined fruit character, reticent rather than open, with a light sprinkle of chalk over some floral, black fruits. The palate has a very polished style, with a shell of fruit sitting around a core of very firm tannins which, although a strong component of the blend, do not over-ride the other elements.

name:

Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2014

Description: Wine description, Notes of graphite, black currant liqueur, incense and camphor make for a complex and intensely penetrating set of aromatics. Dark ruby/purple, medium to full-bodied, with superb concentration and moderate tannin, this wine is a beauty of finesse and substance.

name:

Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Château Clerc Milon'], ['Grapes', 'Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot, Carménère'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Pauillac'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Pauillac'], ['Alcohol content', '14%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites, egg allergens, milk allergens'], ['Wine description', 'The nose reveals finely toasted spice and tobacco notes combined with more intense aromas of red fruit and cherry stone with a mineral touch. Description: Wine description, The nose reveals finely toasted spice and tobacco notes combined with more intense aromas of red fruit and cherry stone with a mineral touch. The palate is full and well-defined, dominated by the lustre of succulent fruit and refined, flavoursome tannins that open on a hint of chocolate. The long, warm-hearted finish is lifted by a slightly saline taste.

Description: Wine description, This wine has an opaque dark red violet colour. With lovely herbal, lavender and blackberry notes on the nose. Tart berry, blackberry, black fruit palate with depth and sweet tannins.

name:
Cos d'Estournel
Cos d'Estournel 2011
about_wine: [['Winery', "Cos d'Estournel"], ['Grapes', '65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Saint-Estèphe'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Estèphe'], ['Alcohol content', '14%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Bottle closure', 'Cork'], ['Wine description', 'The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.']]
Description: Wine description, The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.

name:

Blason de L’Evangile Pomerol 2019
about_wine: [['Winery', "Château l'Évangile"], ['Grapes', '92% Merlot, 8% Cabernet Franc'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Libournais', 'Pomerol'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Pomerol'], ['Alcohol content', '15%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Bottle closure', 'Cork'], ['Wine description', 'Deep, clear colour with hints of violet. Description: Wine description, Deep, clear colour with hints of violet. Fruity nose of red berries (raspberries and redcurrants) with notes of toast. On the palate, the attack is clean with a well-enveloped, balanced tannic structure. The texture is very velvety thanks to the ripe, well-coated tannins. The finish is fruity but it is the quality of the tannins that dominates.

Description: Wine description, Deep, dark colour with hints of violet. Very fruity nose with dark berries (Morello cherries, blackcurrants) and fresh notes of mocha and toast. name:
Cos d'Estournel
Pagodes de Cos 2010
about_wine: [['Winery', "Cos d'Estournel"], ['Grapes', '62% Cabernet Sauvignon, 38% Merlot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Saint-Estèphe'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Estèphe'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'The joy and spontaneity of moments shared with loved ones. An impromptu lunch with friends is the perfect occasion to open a bottle of Pagodes de Cos. It is reminiscent of the simple pleasures of life, like homemade blackcurrant syrup, a bowl of just-picked red cherries or a freshly opened jar of citrus jam. Pagodes de Cos is at once indulgent, comforting and vivacious, like a carefree conversation with family or friends in a familiar place.']]
Description: Wine description, The joy and spontaneity of moments shared with loved ones. An impromptu lunch with friends is the perfect occasion to open a bottle of Pagodes de Cos. It is reminiscent of the simple pleasures of life, like homemade blackcurrant syrup, a bowl of just-picked red cherries or a freshly opened jar of citrus jam. Pagodes de Cos is at once indulgent, comforting and vivacious, like a carefree conversation with family or friends in a familiar place.

name:
Château La Fleur-Pétrus
Pomerol 2006
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Château La Fleur-Pétrus'], ['Grapes', 'Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Petit Verdot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Libournais', 'Pomerol'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Pomerol'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'On the nose a tight core of black fruits, blackcurrants and dark cherries. Beautifully textured on the palate, sweet and quite fleshy, supple and flattering. Lots of ripe tannins but they are very well hidden by this layer of fruit, with a lovely sense of grip coming in. Great acidity at the core. Wonderful structure and balance here, and an elegant substance to the finish.']]
Description: Wine description, On the nose a tight core of black fruits, blackcurrants and dark cherries. Beautifully textured on the palate, sweet and quite fleshy, supple and flattering. Lots of ripe tannins but they are very well hidden by this layer of fruit, with a lovely sense of grip coming in. Great acidity at the core. Wonderful structure and balance here, and an elegant substance to the finish.

name:

about_wine: [['Winery', 'Château Duhart-Milon'], ['Grapes', '100% Cabernet Sauvignon'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Pauillac'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Pauillac'], ['Alcohol content', '12.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'Dark with good concentration, and the nose has a tightly defined fruit character, reticent rather than open, with a light sprinkle of chalk over some floral, black fruits. Description: Wine description, Dark with good concentration, and the nose has a tightly defined fruit character, reticent rather than open, with a light sprinkle of chalk over some floral, black fruits. name:

Description: Wine description, Deep, dark colour with hints of violet. Very fruity nose with dark berries (Morello cherries, blackcurrants) and fresh notes of mocha and toast. On the palate, the attack is refined and silky, with a powerful, balanced tannic structure. The texture is dense and very velvety thanks to the ripe, well-coated tannins. The finish is long with fruity notes, but is dominated by the quality of the tannins.

name:
Château d'Armailhac
Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2000
about_wine: [['Winery', "Château d'Armailhac"], ['Grapes', '58% Cabernet Sauvignon, 42% Merlot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Pauillac'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Pauillac'], ['Alcohol content', '12.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'A dense and deep red with a violet tint, the wine has a still slightly reserved nose which opens with airing on hints of cassis, blackberry and fresh red fruit mingled with touches of cedarwood. Description: Wine description, A dense and deep red with a violet tint, the wine has a still slightly reserved nose which opens with airing on hints of cassis, blackberry and fresh red fruit mingled with touches of cedarwood. The attack is nicely rounded, with well-integrated tannins that fill out on a mid-palate full of fruit. The flavours linger pleasingly in a full and expressive finish that gives the wine a fine overall balance.

about_wine: [['Winery', "Cos d'Estournel"], ['Grapes', 'Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Petit Verdot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Saint-Estèphe'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Estèphe'], ['Alcohol content', '13%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites, egg allergens, milk allergens'], ['Bottle closure', 'Cork'], ['Wine description', 'The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.']]
Grape_Types: [" 'Cabernet Sauvignon", ' Cabernet Franc', ' Merlot', " Petit Verdot'"]

Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.

Aerated, it reveals lightly toasted aromas, followed with hints of ripe fruits and liquorice. The palate is full and soft with tight tannins and a light sweetness. The finish is long and harmonious.

name:
Château l'Évangile
Pomerol 2020
about_wine: [['Winery', "Château l'Évangile"], ['Grapes', '80% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Franc'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Libournais', 'Pomerol'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Pomerol'], ['Alcohol content', '13%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites, egg allergens, milk allergens'], ['Bottle closure', 'Cork'], ['Wine description', 'Deep, dark colour with hints of violet. Description: Wine description, Deep, dark colour with hints of violet. Very fruity nose with dark berries (Morello cherries, blackcurrants) and fresh notes of mocha and toast. On the palate, the attack is refined and silky, with a powerful, balanced tannic structure. The texture is dense and very velvety thanks to the ripe, well-coated tannins. The finish is long with fruity notes, but is dominated by the quality of the tannins.

about_wine: [['Winery', 'Château Angludet'], ['Grapes', '55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Merlot, 10% Petit Verdot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Margaux'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Margaux'], ['Alcohol content', '14%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Bottle closure', 'Cork'], ['Wine description', 'The promisingly sombre ruby hue of this wine is as intense as its distinguished and elegant bouquet with its black fruit aromas, subtly highlighted by spices and toasty, vanilla notes. name:

Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Château Clerc Milon'], ['Grapes', '100% Carménère'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Pauillac'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Pauillac'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'The nose reveals finely toasted spice and tobacco notes combined with more intense aromas of red fruit and cherry stone with a mineral touch. Description: Wine description, The nose reveals finely toasted spice and tobacco notes combined with more intense aromas of red fruit and cherry stone with a mineral touch. The palate is full and well-defined, dominated by the lustre of succulent fruit and refined, flavoursome tannins that open on a hint of chocolate. The long, warm-hearted finish is lifted by a slightly saline taste.

name:
Château Angelus
Le Carillon d’Angélus Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2012
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Château Angelus'], ['Grapes', 'Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Libournais', 'Saint-Émilion', 'Saint-Émilion Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Émilion'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', "Château Angélus has a second wine named Le Carillon d’Angélus. It was first made in 1987 and accounts for 20 to 30% of the estate’s total production, depending on the year. It is blended from varying proportions of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon that are partly picked on unclassified plots with clayey limestone and clayey sandy limestone soils. The vines are cared for in exactly the same way as those used to make the main wine. The same attention is paid to detail and selection during the harvest and winemaking as for the main wine. It is also aged in barrels, but not for so long and only half the wood is new in order to suit the wine's specific requirements. Le Carillon d’Angélus therefore has its own identity and style. It is made to be kept for the mid-term and displays enjoyable fruit aromas of plum and sour cherry and has velvet-smooth tannins."]]
Description: Wine description, "Château Angélus has a second wine named Le Carillon d’Angélus. It was first made in 1987 and accounts for 20 to 30% of the estate’s total production, depending on the year. It is blended from varying proportions of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon that are partly picked on unclassified plots with clayey limestone and clayey sandy limestone soils. The vines are cared for in exactly the same way as those used to make the main wine. The same attention is paid to detail and selection during the harvest and winemaking as for the main wine. It is also aged in barrels, but not for so long and only half the wood is new in order to suit the wines specific requirements. Le Carillon d’Angélus therefore has its own identity and style. It is made to be kept for the mid-term and displays enjoyable fruit aromas of plum and sour cherry and has velvet-smooth tannins."

name:
Château La Fleur-Pétrus
Pomerol 2017
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Château La Fleur-Pétrus'], ['Grapes', '100% Merlot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Libournais', 'Pomerol'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Pomerol'], ['Alcohol content', '14.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Bottle closure', 'Cork'], ['Wine description', 'On the nose a tight core of black fruits, blackcurrants and dark cherries. Beautifully textured on the palate, sweet and quite fleshy, supple and flattering. Lots of ripe tannins but they are very well hidden by this layer of fruit, with a lovely sense of grip coming in. Great acidity at the core. Wonderful structure and balance here, and an elegant substance to the finish.']]
Description: Wine description, On the nose a tight core of black fruits, blackcurrants and dark cherries. Beautifully textured on the palate, sweet and quite fleshy, supple and flattering. Lots of ripe tannins but they are very well hidden by this layer of fruit, with a lovely sense of grip coming in. Great acidity at the core. Wonderful structure and balance here, and an elegant substance to the finish.

Description: Wine description, The joy and spontaneity of moments shared with loved ones. An impromptu lunch with friends is the perfect occasion to open a bottle of Pagodes de Cos. It is reminiscent of the simple pleasures of life, like homemade blackcurrant syrup, a bowl of just-picked red cherries or a freshly opened jar of citrus jam. Pagodes de Cos is at once indulgent, comforting and vivacious, like a carefree conversation with family or friends in a familiar place.

about_wine: [['Winery', 'Domaine Taupenot-Merme'], ['Grapes', '100% Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Nuits', 'Gevrey-Chambertin', 'Charmes-Chambertin Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Nuits Red'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'The displays kirsch as well as candied cherry on the nose, which are allied to (or is that pitted against?) tart rhubarb on a bright, firm palate. Description: Wine description, The displays kirsch as well as candied cherry on the nose, which are allied to (or is that pitted against?) tart rhubarb on a bright, firm palate. This is suffused with both chalky and invigoratingly saline mineral manifestations; rose hip, cherry pit, and smoky black tea adding further, piquant complexity that follows into a long, lip-smacking finish. An extreme expression of its cru, it will strike some tasters as too lean, tart, and bitter, but I find it not quite too much of the above three and tonic-like in its fascination and vivacity

name:

Clos Marey-Monge Monopole 2015
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Château de Pommard'], ['Grapes', 'Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Beaune', 'Pommard'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Beaune Red'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'Hailing from Bourgogne, one of the worlds finest - and most expensive - wine regions, Château de Pommard’s Clos Marey-Monge Monopole is a boldly elegant pinot noir that makes the perfect accompaniment to dinner parties all over the world. ', '', "Château de Pommard Clos Marey-Monge Monopoles 2010 vintage was the winner of Vivino's 2020 Wine Style Awards: Burgundy Côte de Beaune Red, while it’s 2019 vintage ranks in the top 25 Burgundy Côte de Beaune red wines in the United States Right now. ", '', 'Read our reviews, flavor profiles and wine pairing recommendations, or get your hands on this wine today at Vivino US.']]
Description: Wine description, Hailing from Bourgogne, one of the worlds finest - and most expensive - wine regions, Château de Pommard’s Clos Marey-Monge Monopole is a boldly elegant pinot noir that makes the perfect accompaniment to dinner parties all over the world. Described as ‘bold, beautiful and elegant’ by the Vivino community, this wine is dry in style, with notes of red fruit, mushroom, leather and oak, with a slightly tannic aftertaste. Its complex profile makes it an excellent choice for those who are well versed in wine drinking and a fan of big, bold flavors., , If this is your wine of choice for your next dinner party, our community wine lovers it is best paired with beef, veal , game or poultry, making it ideal if you’re looking to serve up some hearty, meat-heavy dishes, but maybe one to avoid opening during light lunches with friends. , , "Château de Pommard Clos Marey-Monge Monopoles 2010 vintage was the winner of Vivinos 2020 Wine Style Awards: Burgundy Côte de Beaune Red, while it’s 2019 vintage ranks in the top 25 Burgundy Côte de Beaune red wines in the United States Right now. ", , Read our reviews, flavor profiles and wine pairing recommendations, or get your hands on this wine today at Vivino US.

name:
Joseph Drouhin
Grands-Echezeaux Grand Cru 2019
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Joseph Drouhin'], ['Grapes', 'Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Nuits', 'Flagey-Échezeaux', 'Grands-Échezeaux Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Nuits Red'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'In its youth, the wine displays aromas of great finesse, reminiscent of cherry and dark chocolate or cocoa bean, which is a delicate and sought after characteristic of this wine. As the wine matures, these aromas evolve towards other refined nuances evoking undergrowth, truffle, fine leather and sometimes light notes of cigar or cedar wood. The result is of great elegance and breed. The tannins are refined and the silk and velvet of the body are a perfect match. Very long aftertaste in which some of the aromas previously encountered are again in evidence and create the most elegant sensation']]
Description: Wine description, In its youth, the wine displays aromas of great finesse, reminiscent of cherry and dark chocolate or cocoa bean, which is a delicate and sought after characteristic of this wine. As the wine matures, these aromas evolve towards other refined nuances evoking undergrowth, truffle, fine leather and sometimes light notes of cigar or cedar wood. The result is of great elegance and breed. The tannins are refined and the silk and velvet of the body are a perfect match. Very long aftertaste in which some of the aromas previously encountered are again in evidence and create the most elegant sensation

name:

Echezeaux Grand Cru 2021
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Domaine Jean Grivot'], ['Grapes', 'Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Nuits', 'Flagey-Échezeaux', 'Grands-Échezeaux Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Nuits Red'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', "The emphasis here is always on exceptionally pure, elegant, finely etched Pinot Noir fruit. wines are well-balanced, and never too alcoholic or tannic. Description: Wine description, "The emphasis here is always on exceptionally pure, elegant, finely etched Pinot Noir fruit. wines are well-balanced, and never too alcoholic or tannic. They are consistently among Burgundys best, and drink well young, but also have the unusual quality of aging very nicely. The better vintages of the Premiers and Grands Crus last up to 12 years."

name:
Méo-Camuzet
Corton Grand Cru 'Les Perrières' 2019
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Méo-Camuzet'], ['Grapes', 'Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Beaune', 'Corton Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Beaune Red'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'Your first impression of les Perrières is that of a typical Corton, as it is so frequently described: powerful, mature, tannic. All these elements necessarily take time to integrate.']]
Description: Wine description, Your first impression of les Perrières is that of a typical Corton, as it is so frequently described: powerful, mature, tannic. But that impression should be moderated because the wine is apparently multifaceted: certainly very mature, which accounts for its fatness, but then mineral with a structured, even tannic finish. All these elements necessarily take time to integrate.

name:
Joseph Drouhin
Clos Saint-Denis Grand Cru 2014
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Joseph Drouhin'], ['Grapes', '100% Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Nuits', 'Morey-Saint-Denis', 'Clos Saint-Denis Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Nuits Red'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'Deep ruby red colour. On the nose, aromas of ripe cherry, lightly spiced up by a touch of cigar and exotic wood. With age, the aromas take on animal or gamey notes. The best time to drink a Clos Saint Denis is when the wine is mature (5 to 10 years of age, depending on the vintages) in order to enjoy the perfect harmony that exists between acidity, \\"gras\\" (velvety texture) and tannin.']]
Description: Wine description, Deep ruby red colour. On the nose, aromas of ripe cherry, lightly spiced up by a touch of cigar and exotic wood. With age, the aromas take on animal or gamey notes. The best time to drink a Clos Saint Denis is when the wine is mature (5 to 10 years of age, depending on the vintages) in order to enjoy the perfect harmony that exists between acidity, \\"gras\\" (velvety texture) and tannin.

name:
Joseph Drouhin
Chambertin Clos de Bèze Grand Cru 2018
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Joseph Drouhin'], ['Grapes', '100% Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Nuits', 'Gevrey-Chambertin', 'Chambertin-Clos de Bèze Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Nuits Red'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'A beautiful, intense ruby-red colour. Powerful but refined aromas. When the wine is young, the aromas are reminiscent of black cherry and dark chocolate. With age, they evolve towards notes of undergrowth, truffle and liquorice. After 15 years or so, the aromas of candied fruit remain but are mingled with nuances of leather and musk. Tannins provide a good structure, perfectly balanced by the velvety texture of the wine.']]
Description: Wine description, A beautiful, intense ruby-red colour. Powerful but refined aromas. When the wine is young, the aromas are reminiscent of black cherry and dark chocolate. With age, they evolve towards notes of undergrowth, truffle and liquorice. After 15 years or so, the aromas of candied fruit remain but are mingled with nuances of leather and musk. Tannins provide a good structure, perfectly balanced by the velvety texture of the wine.

name:
Château de Chamirey
Mercurey 1er Cru 'Clos du Roi' 2019
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Château de Chamirey'], ['Grapes', '100% Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte Chalonnaise', 'Mercurey', 'Mercurey Premier Cru', "Mercurey 1er Cru 'Le Clos du Roy'"], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte Chalonnaise Red'], ['Alcohol content', '15%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'Celebrated as ‘exquisite’, ‘lively’ and an ‘absolute killer pinot noir’ by the Vivino community, this dry red wine is sophisticated yet playful at the same time.', '', 'Located in France, the historic Château de Chamirey winery overlooks the picturesque village of Chamirey and was built in the 18th century. Occupying a beautiful spot on a rocky headland, Château de Chamirey’s unique geographical location makes it the optimum location for grape growing and winemaking. ', '', "Boasting notes of red fruit, as well as oaky and earthy flavors such as chocolate, leather and mushroom, the profile of Château de Chamirey Mercurey 1er Cru 'Clos du Roi' pairs extremely well with beef, veal, game and poultry. This versatility is one of the many reasons why the Vivino community holds it in such high regard.", '', "If you’re looking for a specific year to try first, Château de Chamirey Mercurey 1er Cru 'Clos du Roi' 2016 vintage is most highly rated among the Vivino community – why not take a look at the hundreds of reviews to see for yourself? Alternatively, Château de Chamirey Mercurey 1er Cru 'Clos du Roi' 2017 vintage is a top rated wine for this year, so another excellent choice for any red wine lover."]]
Description: Wine description, Celebrated as ‘exquisite’, ‘lively’ and an ‘absolute killer pinot noir’ by the Vivino community, this dry red wine is sophisticated yet playful at the same time., , Located in France, the historic Château de Chamirey winery overlooks the picturesque village of Chamirey and was built in the 18th century. Occupying a beautiful spot on a rocky headland, Château de Chamirey’s unique geographical location makes it the optimum location for grape growing and winemaking. , , "Boasting notes of red fruit, as well as oaky and earthy flavors such as chocolate, leather and mushroom, the profile of Château de Chamirey Mercurey 1er Cru Clos du Roi pairs extremely well with beef, veal, game and poultry. This versatility is one of the many reasons why the Vivino community holds it in such high regard.", , "If you’re looking for a specific year to try first, Château de Chamirey Mercurey 1er Cru Clos du Roi 2016 vintage is most highly rated among the Vivino community – why not take a look at the hundreds of reviews to see for yourself? Alternatively, Château de Chamirey Mercurey 1er Cru Clos du Roi 2017 vintage is a top rated wine for this year, so another excellent choice for any red wine lover."

name:

about_wine: [['Winery', 'Joseph Drouhin'], ['Grapes', 'Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Nuits', 'Gevrey-Chambertin', 'Chambertin-Clos de Bèze Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Nuits Red'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'A beautiful, intense ruby-red colour. Description: Wine description, A beautiful, intense ruby-red colour. Powerful but refined aromas. When the wine is young, the aromas are reminiscent of black cherry and dark chocolate. With age, they evolve towards notes of undergrowth, truffle and liquorice. After 15 years or so, the aromas of candied fruit remain but are mingled with nuances of leather and musk. Tannins provide a good structure, perfectly balanced by the velvety texture of the wine.

Description: Wine description, Vivid red colour. Intense and complex aromas, reminiscent of candied fruit or fruit jelly, raspberry, blackberry, and a light woody touch. As the wine ages, these aromas evolve towards subtle notes of mushroom and spices, such as nutmeg. When the wine is younger, the flavors highlight a nice framework marked by fine tannins. Long and persistent in the aftertaste, with lingering notes of candy and spice

name:

about_wine: [['Winery', 'Philippe et Vincent Lécheneaut'], ['Grapes', 'Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Nuits', 'Chambolle-Musigny'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Nuits Red'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'The intensity and the finesse are indeed expressed with an elegant subtlety. Description: Wine description, The intensity and the finesse are indeed expressed with an elegant subtlety. The violet, the small red fruits make up its bouquet of a marked typicity. Older, it evolves towards the ripe spicy fruit, the prune, the truffle. Rich, bouquet and complex, it lines the palace of silk and lace. Description: Wine description, The colour may vary from cherry to ruby. A large palette of seductive, aromas which can evolve, one minute to the next, from raspberry to kirsch. Later, the nose may display some truffle,, mushroom or woody notes and, in some years, musky, even animal nuances. The aromas are always restrained and, elegant. On the palate, a wonderful silky sensation, with very refined tannins. Intensity, velvety texture and lively, freshness: this well-named wine is a masterpiece of harmony. The aftertaste is very delicate and leaves an impression of, supreme refinement

name:

about_wine: [['Winery', 'Domaine Jean Grivot'], ['Grapes', 'Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Nuits', 'Nuits-Saint-Georges', 'Nuits-Saint-Georges Premier Cru', "Nuits-Saint-Georges 1er Cru 'Aux Boudots'"], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Nuits Red'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'It has lighter in colour, body and tannins. When mature, the best wines develop a sensuous, silky mouth feel with the fruit flavours deepening and gamey "sous-bois" nuances emerging.']]
Description: Wine description, It has lighter in colour, body and tannins. However the best wines have grip, complexity and an intensity of fruit seldom found in wine from other grapes. Young Pinot Noir can smell almost sweet, redolent with freshly crushed raspberries, cherries and redcurrants. When mature, the best wines develop a sensuous, silky mouth feel with the fruit flavours deepening and gamey "sous-bois" nuances emerging.

name:

Corton Grand Cru 2021
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Domaine Tollot-Beaut'], ['Grapes', 'Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Beaune', 'Corton Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Beaune Red'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites, egg allergens, milk allergens'], ['Wine description', 'It is youthful scarlet, greedily tearing. In the mouth very accessible with candied cherries and sweet ripe strawberries, spices, rich and velvety in texture -typical Tollot Beaut. Ripe tannins, backed by eighteen months new French oak, full of flavor, though this wine will evolve for another six years before he is at his best. An enticing well-balanced wine. Description: Wine description, It is youthful scarlet, greedily tearing. Sensual perfume of wild strawberry, cherry compote and sweet flowers. Nice smoky touch of vanilla and earthy autumnal tones, also a very nice graphite minerality. In the mouth very accessible with candied cherries and sweet ripe strawberries, spices, rich and velvety in texture -typical Tollot Beaut. Ripe tannins, backed by eighteen months new French oak, full of flavor, though this wine will evolve for another six years before he is at his best. An enticing well-balanced wine. An investment for your cellar. Have patience.

name:
Joseph Drouhin
Charmes-Chambertin Grand Cru 2016
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Joseph Drouhin'], ['Grapes', '100% Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Nuits', 'Gevrey-Chambertin', 'Charmes-Chambertin Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Nuits Red'], ['Alcohol content', '13%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites, egg allergens'], ['Wine description', 'A generous and distinctive wine, often superb. The colour is intense and bright. On the nose, the first impression that arises is that of cherry. Then, woody and fine spicy aromas appear, with an elegant hint of musk in some vintages. The flavours are extraordinary in their richness and harmony, neither too rough nor too heavy. The architecture of the wine is held up by fine and noble tannins, giving the body a silky texture (called "gras"). Acidity brings energy and liveliness to the whole. The aftertaste is a pure delight']]
Description: Wine description, A generous and distinctive wine, often superb. The colour is intense and bright. On the nose, the first impression that arises is that of cherry. Then, woody and fine spicy aromas appear, with an elegant hint of musk in some vintages. The flavours are extraordinary in their richness and harmony, neither too rough nor too heavy. The architecture of the wine is held up by fine and noble tannins, giving the body a silky texture (called "gras"). Acidity brings energy and liveliness to the whole. The aftertaste is a pure delight

name:

Grands-Échézeaux Grand Cru 2018
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Clos Frantin'], ['Grapes', '100% Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Nuits', 'Flagey-Échezeaux', 'Grands-Échezeaux Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Nuits Red'], ['Alcohol content', '13%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites, egg allergens, milk allergens'], ['Wine description', 'Deep red color tinged with violet. The nose is elegant, racy, and develops stone fruit aromas of black berries, supported by spicy notes and tobacco. When older, these aromas evolve towards aromas of undergrowth, truffle and leather. Description: Wine description, Deep red color tinged with violet. The nose is elegant, racy, and develops stone fruit aromas of black berries, supported by spicy notes and tobacco. When older, these aromas evolve towards aromas of undergrowth, truffle and leather. The palate is velvety and balanced with fine ripe tannins, with notes of gingerbread and candied fruit. As for the final, it is extremely long and aromatic.

Description: Wine description, A notably floral and complex nose of high-toned red berry fruit that is liberally laced with earth and stone nuances marries seamlessly into silky-textured middle weight flavors that are not quite as concentrated as those of the Clos Prieur but are markedly finer. There is obvious minerality and a saline character to the gorgeously well-balanced and harmonious finish that delivers excellent length. A wine of finesse and understatement. Sweet spot Outstanding

about_wine: [['Winery', 'Domaine Tollot-Beaut'], ['Grapes', '100% Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Beaune', 'Corton Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Beaune Red'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'It is youthful scarlet, greedily tearing. Ripe tannins, backed by eighteen months new French oak, full of flavor, though this wine will evolve for another six years before he is at his best. An enticing well-balanced wine. An investment for your cellar. Have patience.']]
Description: Wine description, It is youthful scarlet, greedily tearing. Sensual perfume of wild strawberry, cherry compote and sweet flowers. Nice smoky touch of vanilla and earthy autumnal tones, also a very nice graphite minerality. In the mouth very accessible with candied cherries and sweet ripe strawberries, spices, rich and velvety in texture -typical Tollot Beaut. Ripe tannins, backed by eighteen months new French oak, full of flavor, though this wine will evolve for another six years before he is at his best. An enticing well-balanced wine. An investment for your cellar. Have patience.

name:

Charmes-Chambertin Grand Cru 2020
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Joseph Drouhin'], ['Grapes', 'Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Nuits', 'Gevrey-Chambertin', 'Charmes-Chambertin Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Nuits Red'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'A generous and distinctive wine, often superb. Description: Wine description, A generous and distinctive wine, often superb. The colour is intense and bright. On the nose, the first impression that arises is that of cherry. Then, woody and fine spicy aromas appear, with an elegant hint of musk in some vintages. The flavours are extraordinary in their richness and harmony, neither too rough nor too heavy. The architecture of the wine is held up by fine and noble tannins, giving the body a silky texture (called "gras"). Acidity brings energy and liveliness to the whole. The aftertaste is a pure delight

Description: Wine description, The colour may vary from cherry to ruby. A large palette of seductive, aromas which can evolve, one minute to the next, from raspberry to kirsch. Later, the nose may display some truffle,, mushroom or woody notes and, in some years, musky, even animal nuances. The aromas are always restrained and, elegant. On the palate, a wonderful silky sensation, with very refined tannins. Intensity, velvety texture and lively, freshness: this well-named wine is a masterpiece of harmony. The aftertaste is very delicate and leaves an impression of, supreme refinement

name:
Château de Chamirey
Mercurey 1er Cru 'Clos du Roi' 2020
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Château de Chamirey'], ['Grapes', '100% Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte Chalonnaise', 'Mercurey', 'Mercurey Premier Cru', "Mercurey 1er Cru 'Le Clos du Roy'"], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte Chalonnaise Red'], ['Alcohol content', '15.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Bottle closure', 'Cork'], ['Wine description', 'Celebrated as ‘exquisite’, ‘lively’ and an ‘absolute killer pinot noir’ by the Vivino community, this dry red wine is sophisticated yet playful at the same time.', '', 'Located in France, the historic Château de Chamirey winery overlooks the picturesque village of Chamirey and was built in the 18th century. Occupying a beautiful spot on a rocky headland, Château de Chamirey’s unique geographical location makes it the optimum location for grape growing and winemaking. ', '', "Boasting notes of red fruit, as well as oaky and earthy flavors such as chocolate, leather and mushroom, the profile of Château de Chamirey Mercurey 1er Cru 'Clos du Roi' pairs extremely well with beef, veal, game and poultry. This versatility is one of the many reasons why the Vivino community holds it in such high regard.", '', "If you’re looking for a specific year to try first, Château de Chamirey Mercurey 1er Cru 'Clos du Roi' 2016 vintage is most highly rated among the Vivino community – why not take a look at the hundreds of reviews to see for yourself? Alternatively, Château de Chamirey Mercurey 1er Cru 'Clos du Roi' 2017 vintage is a top rated wine for this year, so another excellent choice for any red wine lover."]]
Description: Wine description, Celebrated as ‘exquisite’, ‘lively’ and an ‘absolute killer pinot noir’ by the Vivino community, this dry red wine is sophisticated yet playful at the same time., , Located in France, the historic Château de Chamirey winery overlooks the picturesque village of Chamirey and was built in the 18th century. Occupying a beautiful spot on a rocky headland, Château de Chamirey’s unique geographical location makes it the optimum location for grape growing and winemaking. , , "Boasting notes of red fruit, as well as oaky and earthy flavors such as chocolate, leather and mushroom, the profile of Château de Chamirey Mercurey 1er Cru Clos du Roi pairs extremely well with beef, veal, game and poultry. This versatility is one of the many reasons why the Vivino community holds it in such high regard.", , "If you’re looking for a specific year to try first, Château de Chamirey Mercurey 1er Cru Clos du Roi 2016 vintage is most highly rated among the Vivino community – why not take a look at the hundreds of reviews to see for yourself? Alternatively, Château de Chamirey Mercurey 1er Cru Clos du Roi 2017 vintage is a top rated wine for this year, so another excellent choice for any red wine lover."

name:

about_wine: [['Winery', 'Domaine Jean Grivot'], ['Grapes', 'Pinot Noir'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Nuits', 'Nuits-Saint-Georges', 'Nuits-Saint-Georges Premier Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Nuits Red'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'The violet to indigo in color with relatively thin skins, and it is said to have been cultivated in France for more than 2,000 years. At its best, Pinot Noir creates elegant wines that are filled with primary red fruit aromas and flavors while young, revealing with an array of secondary characteristics like earth, smoke, violet, truffle and game with age. The varietal is also known, perhaps better than any, for its ability to translate terroir, or a sense of place.']]
Description: Wine description, The violet to indigo in color with relatively thin skins, and it is said to have been cultivated in France for more than 2,000 years. At its best, Pinot Noir creates elegant wines that are filled with primary red fruit aromas and flavors while young, revealing with an array of secondary characteristics like earth, smoke, violet, truffle and game with age. The varietal is also known, perhaps better than any, for its ability to translate terroir, or a sense of place.

Description: Wine description, "Dark bright crimson. Peppery notes on top of red fruit. Lots of energy. Sinews and masses of bright fruit. Not that intense or sweet but beautifully balanced. Description: Wine description, "It was important to go back to basics and restore the soils natural balance, study yields, harvesting dates, pre-fermention maceration, fermentation temperatures, the use of oak,…that is do everything possible to make pleasurable, fine, rich, full wines for long-term ageing which reflect Burgundys unique terroir."

Description: Wine description, Tasting Griotte-Chambertin is always cause for reflexion: the aromas are complex and subtle, with hints of cherry liqueur, preserved cherry, fine leather, nutmeg. Description: Wine description, A wine with a beautiful dark color, with purple reflections. On the nose, we are seduced by the intensity and the purity of the fruit,by the discrete perception of the aromas coming from the ageing in barrels, by the touch of velvet that bring so much complexity. name:

about_wine: [['Winery', 'Pierre Usseglio'], ['Grapes', 'Shiraz/Syrah, Grenache, Mourvedre'], ['France', 'Rhone Valley', 'Southern Rhône', 'Châteauneuf-du-Pape'], ['Wine style', 'Southern Rhône Châteauneuf-du-Pape Red'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'The outstanding 2003 Chateauneuf du Pape Tradition is a full-bodied, peppery wine that oozes the character of Provence with its notes of lavender, herbes de Provence, and sweet black cherries and raspberries. Description: Wine description, The outstanding 2003 Chateauneuf du Pape Tradition is a full-bodied, peppery wine that oozes the character of Provence with its notes of lavender, herbes de Provence, and sweet black cherries and raspberries. Some licorice, saddle leather, and salty sea breeze notes also make it into the character of this full-bodied, concentrated wine which is silky enough to be drunk now or cellared for 10-12 years.

Description: Wine description, With a rich, deep color, the perfume exhibits pepper, black raspberry jam, grenadine, garrigue, licorice and raspberry liqueur. The opulent, silky textured fruit coats your mouth and palate, ending in a long, peppery, sweet, pure, red cherry liqueur finish.

Description: Wine description, On the bright purple, this wine with a very expressive bouquet exudes aromas of cassis and boysenberry, and attractive fl oral and spicy nuances that adorn its liveliness. Exquisite flavors of red and black fruits are then vigorously enhance the exoticism of its light fl oral presence and impressive sharpness.

Description: Wine description, It has super nice wine that is just starting to come around. Lots of smoke, dark cherries, black raspberries, earth and some vanilla bean on the nose. Silky, fresh, crisp, ripe, sweet red fruits carry all the way through.

name:
Domaine Lafond
Châteauneuf-du-Pape Roc Epine 2017
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Domaine Lafond'], ['Grapes', 'Shiraz/Syrah, Grenache'], ['France', 'Rhone Valley', 'Southern Rhône', 'Châteauneuf-du-Pape'], ['Wine style', 'Southern Rhône Châteauneuf-du-Pape Red'], ['Alcohol content', '14%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'It is classic Chateauneuf here, one that we are extremely impressed with. An elegant and fruit focused aroma profile offers up raspberries, black cherries, licorice (in spade fulls), sweet spice, white pepper and a little rose petal. The palate is extremely elegant again. A medium body, bordering on full, with juicy fine tannins that give the wine a classical structure. Red and black berry fruits, pepper, licorice and a little tobacco are all evident on the palate. A very long and mouth watering finish. Drinks particularly well now, but will benefit from a few more years in the bottle.']]
Description: Wine description, It is classic Chateauneuf here, one that we are extremely impressed with. An elegant and fruit focused aroma profile offers up raspberries, black cherries, licorice (in spade fulls), sweet spice, white pepper and a little rose petal. The palate is extremely elegant again. A medium body, bordering on full, with juicy fine tannins that give the wine a classical structure. Red and black berry fruits, pepper, licorice and a little tobacco are all evident on the palate. A very long and mouth watering finish. Drinks particularly well now, but will benefit from a few more years in the bottle.

name:

Description: Wine description, It reveals black fruit aromas (blackcurrant, blackberry) mixed with spices and scents of dried herbs and roasted coffee. Great aromatic complexity. Description: Wine description, The outstanding 2003 Chateauneuf du Pape Tradition is a full-bodied, peppery wine that oozes the character of Provence with its notes of lavender, herbes de Provence, and sweet black cherries and raspberries. Some licorice, saddle leather, and salty sea breeze notes also make it into the character of this full-bodied, concentrated wine which is silky enough to be drunk now or cellared for 10-12 years.

Description: Wine description, It has lots of warm black fruit and plum aromas, with cinnamon, spices, pepper and a hint of vanilla. name:
Barton & Guestier
Les Roches Noires Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2021
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Barton & Guestier'], ['Grapes', 'Shiraz/Syrah, Grenache'], ['France', 'Rhone Valley', 'Southern Rhône', 'Châteauneuf-du-Pape'], ['Wine style', 'Southern Rhône Châteauneuf-du-Pape Red'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'The name « Les Roches Noires » refers to the Syrah, one of the dominating grapes of our', 'Châteauneuf-du-Pape which expresses its character on this rocky soil and gives a deep', 'purple color to our wine.', '', 'Region: Southern Cotes du Rhône vineyard, between Avignon and Orange.', 'Grape Varieties: 50% Syrah, 50% Grenache.', 'Soil: composed mainly of big round shape stones called “gallet” mixed with sandy clay.', 'Mediterranean climate, sunny and warm.', 'Vinification: De-stalked grapes-alcoholic fermentation at high temperature (30-35°C / 86-', '95°F) with daily rack and return.', 'Ageing : Partly aged in oak.', '', 'Deep cherry red colour. Complex nose with aromas of ripe fruits (blueberry, plum) mixed with toasted and licorice', 'hints. Rich on the palate, mixing the character of the fruit with the warmth of the spices. Round', 'finish with lively notes of mint.', 'Best served between 16°C and 18°C / 60°F and 65°F.']]
Description: Wine description, The name « Les Roches Noires » refers to the Syrah, one of the dominating grapes of our, Châteauneuf-du-Pape which expresses its character on this rocky soil and gives a deep, purple color to our wine., , Region: Southern Cotes du Rhône vineyard, between Avignon and Orange., Grape Varieties: 50% Syrah, 50% Grenache., Soil: composed mainly of big round shape stones called “gallet” mixed with sandy clay., Mediterranean climate, sunny and warm., Vinification: De-stalked grapes-alcoholic fermentation at high temperature (30-35°C / 86-, 95°F) with daily rack and return., Ageing : Partly aged in oak., , Deep cherry red colour. Complex nose with aromas of ripe fruits (blueberry, plum) mixed with toasted and licorice, hints. Rich on the palate, mixing the character of the fruit with the warmth of the spices. Round, finish with lively notes of mint., Best served between 16°C and 18°C / 60°F and 65°F.

Description: Wine description, It has a hints of vanilla, incense and cola. fleshy,mineral-laced raspberry and blueberry flavors gain sweet ness and depth with air, picking up suave notes of lavender and allspice.finishes silky and extremely long, with resonating spiciness and smooth, harmonious tannins.

name:
Joseph Drouhin
Montrachet Grand Cru Marquis de Laguiche 1998
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Joseph Drouhin'], ['Grapes', 'Chardonnay'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Beaune', 'Puligny-Montrachet', 'Montrachet Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Beaune White'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'An authentic masterpiece! This wine should be regarded as the yardstick by which all other Burgundies should be judged. The colour has a splendid golden sheen. On the nose, a multitude of aromas are a pleasure to discover: floral notes of lily of the valley, peach blossom, exotic fruit, honey, grilled almonds, even exotic woods at times. On the palate,', 'the structure is dominated by a harmonious roundness which never imparts any heaviness. The aftertaste is exceptionally long and enhances the finesse of the whole. A glorious symphony of sensations!']]
Description: Wine description, An authentic masterpiece! This wine should be regarded as the yardstick by which all other Burgundies should be judged. The colour has a splendid golden sheen. On the nose, a multitude of aromas are a pleasure to discover: floral notes of lily of the valley, peach blossom, exotic fruit, honey, grilled almonds, even exotic woods at times. On the palate,, the structure is dominated by a harmonious roundness which never imparts any heaviness. The aftertaste is exceptionally long and enhances the finesse of the whole. A glorious symphony of sensations!

Description: Wine description, The 2013 Meursault 1er Cru Porusots has a lifted bouquet with flinty notes emerging with aeration, a neatly attired Porosuts, straitlaced and focused. The palate has a lot of tension on the entry, lime zest and orange sorbet notes lining the tensile finish that shows very good persistence. This is like the talented but quiet student who rarely puts up his or her hand: no need to show off, the quality is all there.

name:

Le Montrachet Grand Cru 2019
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Amiot Guy'], ['Grapes', '100% Chardonnay'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Beaune', 'Puligny-Montrachet', 'Montrachet Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Beaune White'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'Usual characteristics include light yellow-green hints in a shiny and limpid wine. Thanks to its exceptional terroir of stones and abondant sunshine, the nose is complex and flattering quite soon. Description: Wine description, Usual characteristics include light yellow-green hints in a shiny and limpid wine. Thanks to its exceptional terroir of stones and abondant sunshine, the nose is complex and flattering quite soon. Aromatic generosity of the nose is confirmed by a deep and unctuous mouth revealing fresh minty and white fruit with honeyed nuts notes. Persistent and mineral retro-olfaction. Ends with a lingering finish enhanced by the nerve of morning sun and mineral stony under-soil.

name:

about_wine: [['Winery', 'Joseph Drouhin'], ['Grapes', '100% Chardonnay'], ['France', 'Bourgogne', 'Côte de Beaune', 'Chassagne-Montrachet', 'Chassagne-Montrachet Premier Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Burgundy Côte de Beaune White'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites, egg allergens, milk allergens'], ['Bottle closure', 'Cork'], ['Wine description', 'This is a wonderful occasion to savour a great wine.Admirable light golden colour. Description: Wine description, This is a wonderful occasion to savour a great wine.Admirable light golden colour. Intense and elegant aromas come to the fore : hawthorn, apricot notes, evolving towards hints of blond tobacco. As the wine ages, there are nuances of dried fruit and rare spices. A silky texture and a subtle touch of tannin give a true personality to the wine. Remarkable aftertaste. A great white Burgundy!

Description: Wine description, A complex and generous wine, with a rare elegance. The colour is extraordinarily luminous. On the nose, a palette of, interesting and varied aromas: syrup, grilled almond, preserved fruit. In the mouth, a silky and ample texture which does, not exclude freshness or lightness. Long on the palate, with flavours recalling grilled bread and fruit jam. Always a, consummate example of a white Burgundy, this wine is perfection!

Description: Wine description, The pure mineral dominance of Puligny is clearly revealed here. The south-east exposure and the slope topography together with the vine age bring richness and complexity. Description: Wine description, It is very limestone soil of this plot makes this wine one of the most mineral Saint-Aubin. , Based on pure and hard limestone in Montceau is the essence of minerality. Description: Wine description, "It has lemon curd, slate, seashore, spices and caramel on the nose and palate. Ripe and powerful with firm structure and good length. Comes across as something of a mix between a classic Chablis and a Côte d’Or Chardonnay. Very enjoyable, but may well disappoint if youre religious about understated, steely and un-oaked Chablis."
